lines.gurmukhi: sbd suriq Awpw Koie gurdwsu hoie srb mY pUrn bHmu kir mwnIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Sabad Surati Aapaa Khoi Gurdaasu Hoi , Sarab Mai Pooran Brahamu Kari Maaneeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: By contemplating and absorbing oneself in the name obtained by the blessings of a True Guru, and shedding the feelings of mine and his, one becomes a servant of the Guru. Such a servant acknowledges the presence of one Lord everywhere.

lines.gurmukhi: kwst Agin mwlw sUqR gors gobMs eyk Aau Anyk ko ibbyk phcwnIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Kaasat Agani Maalaa Sootr Goras Gobansa , Ayk Au Anayk Ko Bibayk Pahachaaneeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: As the same fire exists in all the woods, different beads are arranged in the same thread; as all shades and species of cows yield milk of the same colour; similarly the slave of True Guru achieves the wisdom and knowledge of the presence of one Lord in a

lines.gurmukhi: locn s√çn muK nwskw Anyk soqR dyKY sunY bolY mn mYk aur AwnIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Lochan Sravan Moukh Naasakaa Anayk Sotra , Daykhai Sounai Bolai Man Maik Ur Aaneeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: As all that is seen by the eyes, heard by the ears and said by the tongue reaches the mind, similarly the slave of the Guru sees one Lord residing in all beings and lodges Him in his mind.

lines.gurmukhi: gur isK sMD imly sohM sohI Eiq poiq joqI joiq imlq joqI srUp jwnIAY ]108]
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikh Sandh Milay Sohan Sohee Aoti Poti , Jotee Joti Milat Jotee Saroop Jaaneeai ?108?

Shabad OS B.translation: The union of a Sikh with his Guru makes him utter Lord's name repeatedly and enjoins in Him like warp and weft. When his light merges with light eternal, he too acquires the form of light divine. (108)
